page.title: 16SENTINEL SQ.-SHOPPING AREA.
page.content: Sentinel Square is a shopping precinct in Brent Street and was completed in 1971. It is typical of High Street development all over the country. In this case the Classic Cinema, a pub called the Rose and Crown, a factory, and flats were demolished to provide the land to build the complex of shops and flats. Sentinel Square comtains a large Tesco supermarket, a Midland Bank, an Electricity showroom, and 14 shops. Although Sentinel Square is not covered there is plenty of cover at the entrance at Brent Street which was originally a small road called Bell View Road. The interior of the square is paved and attractively landscaped with shrubs and plants. As an infill exercise it sits very unhappily in Brent Street.
